summary: Internal email chain among law enforcement personnel discussing the challenge of providing victim notification letters for individuals interviewed in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The correspondence centers on how to assist victims applying for compensation while navigating the constraints of an active investigation and the legal definition of a federal crime victim.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the investigation; individuals are being identified as his victims for the purpose of victim notification letters and compensation.

events.title: Request for Victim Notification Letters
events.description: Law enforcement is contacted with a request for victim notification letters from the FBI for individuals formally interviewed as part of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, to assist them in applying for the victim compensation fund.

keyFacts: Victims of Jeffrey Epstein were requesting formal notification letters from the FBI to apply for the victim compensation fund.

The FBI was hesitant to provide standard letters because not all interviewed individuals necessarily met the legal definition of a victim of a federal crime, despite being negatively affected by Epstein.
The investigation was still active at the time of this correspondence (July 2020), preventing the release of FBI interview reports (302s).
Law enforcement personnel were coordinating internally to determine how to appropriately assist all affected individuals while adhering to legal protocols.
